com.ibm.opencard.access
Class MFC35AccessParser

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ibm.opencard.access.MFC35AccessParser
public class MFC35AccessParser
extends java.lang.Object
implements MFCLazyAccessParser

Interprets access conditions in MFC 3.5 status information. This parser is suitable for MFC cards 3.5 up to 4.1 at least.
The card operating systems supported encode the access conditions for six command classes in five bytes. For each command class, there are four bits specifying the access conditions and two bits specifying an optional key, which is needed for some of the access conditions.

Method Detail

parseAccessInformation

public MFCAccessInformation parseAccessInformation(byte[] data,
                                                   int offset)
                                            throws BadHeaderException
Interprets MFC 3.5 and above file status information. Extracts and returns the access information encoded there.
This method is not static since it is required for implementing the interface MFCAccessParser.
Parameters:
data - the status information to parse
offset - index of first byte to parse in data
Returns:
the decoded access information
Throws:
BadHeaderException - if the data cannot be parsed correctly
See Also:
MFCAccessParser

parseAccessConditions

public MFCAccessConditions parseAccessConditions(byte[] data,
                                                 int offset,
                                                 int cmdclass)
                                          throws opencard.core.service.CardServiceInvalidParameterException
Interprets status information for a specific command class. Extracts and returns the access information encoded.
Although this method can be invoked by several threads simultaneously, it is not synchronized. There is no need for synchronization, since all attribute accesses are read-only.
This method is not static since it is required for implementing the interface MFCLazyAccessParser.
Specified by:
parseAccessConditions in interface MFCLazyAccessParser
Parameters:
data - status information to parse
offset - index of first byte of access information
cmdclass - command class for which access conditions are needed
Returns:
a Java representation of the access conditions for the specified command class
Throws:
opencard.core.service.CardServiceInvalidParameterException - if the data cannot be parsed correctly
See Also:
MFCLazyAccessParser
